intro: Tetrapterys chloroptera, commonly known as the green-winged acacia, is a species of flowering plant in the legume family. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil and Peru. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves with four pairs of leaflets, giving it the genus name "Tetrapterys." Its flowers are typically yellow or greenish-yellow, and it produces small, flat pods that contain seeds. Tetrapterys chloroptera is often found in dry forests and savannas, where it plays a role in nitrogen fixation through its symbiotic relationship with soil bacteria.
